pageContext.claim: “Remember we had a certain Republican running a number of years ago, got almost no votes in Philadelphia, doesn't work that way.”
pageContext.analysis: False. Romney did not receive almost no votes in heavily Democratic Philadelphia in the 2012 election, though in 59 of the city's voting divisions, or precincts, he received no votes. (Citywide, about a quarter of all voting divisions contain fewer than 20 registered Republicans.) Overall, Romney received 14 percent of the vote in Philadelphia, which still amounts to nearly 100,000 votes. In 2020, Joe Biden received more than 600,000 votes, or 81 percent of Philly's presidential votes, to Trump's roughly 18 percent or 133,000 votes.
